title: World-Wide
text:
Pfizer will seek clearance from U.S. regulators in coming weeks to distribute a booster shot of its Covid-19 vaccine to heighten protection against infections as new virus strains rise.

Children are at extremely slim risk of dying from Covid-19, according to some of the most comprehensive studies to date, which indicate the threat might be even lower than previously thought.

---

The FDA narrowed the prescribing instructions for a new Alzheimer's drug, recommending the therapy be given to people with early-stage symptoms of the disease.

---

Haiti's interim prime minister said his government was intensifying a manhunt following the assassination of the president, arresting several suspects believed to have participated in the killing.

---

New York, Massachusetts and 13 other states signed on to a settlement with Purdue Pharma and its Sackler family owners, improving chances of court approval for a plan to resolve opioid lawsuits.

---

Michael Avenatti was sentenced to 2 1/2 years in prison for trying to extort Nike for more than $20 million, capping the public downfall of the celebrity lawyer.
